conclusion: Refraction is the bending of light as it passes from one medium to another.
The refractive index of a medium measures how much light slows down in that medium.
The higher the refractive index, the more the light bends.
Two identical monochromatic light beams hit cups A and B at the same incident angle.
The refraction angles are such that β1 > β2.
Using Snell's Law, n2 is inversely related to sin β.
If β1 > β2, then sin β1 > sin β2 implies nA < nB.
Greater concentration of sucrose water means greater refractive index.
Since nA < nB, the concentration of sucrose in cup A is lower than in cup B.
No, the concentration of sucrose water in cup A is not higher.
